snippet: The costs include investigations of people applying for security clearances, equipment like safes and special computer gear, and training for government personnel, as well as salaries.
abstract: Federal government releases annual report showing that it spent more than $11 billion to protect its secrets in 2011, double the cost of a decade ago; costs, which do not take into account spending by spy agencies, include investigations of people applying for security clearances, equipment, salaries and training for government personnel.
